text: 38 CFR Ch. I (7–1–03 Edition)
label: TITLE

text: Certification requirements.
label: BODY

text: any
label: BODY

text: case
label: BODY

text: which
label: BODY

text: through 36.4393 are applicable, as set
label: BODY

text: forth in § 36.4391, no action will be
label: BODY

text: taken by the Department of Veterans
label: BODY

text: Affairs on any request for appraisal re-
label: BODY

text: lating to proposed construction, site
label: BODY

text: approval of land to be improved by a
label: BODY

text: builder, sponsor or developer for the
label: BODY

text: construction of housing thereon, or for
label: BODY

text: a direct loan fund reservation commit-
label: BODY

text: ment unless the builder, sponsor or de-
label: BODY

text: veloper has furnished the Department
label: BODY

text: of Veterans Affairs a signed certifi-
label: BODY

text: cation in form as follows:
label: BODY

text: To induce the Department of Veterans Af-
label: BODY

text: fairs to act on any request submitted by or
label: BODY

text: on behalf of the undersigned for site approval
label: BODY

text: of land to be improved for the construction
label: BODY

text: of housing thereon to be financed with loans
label: BODY

text: guaranteed, insured or made by the Depart-
label: BODY

text: ment of Veterans Affairs, or for establish-
label: BODY

text: ment by the Department of Veterans Affairs
label: BODY

text: of reasonable value relating to proposed con-
label: BODY

text: struction or for direct loan fund reservation
label: BODY

text: commitments,
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: undersigned
label: BODY

text: hereby
label: BODY

text: agrees that it will incorporate or cause to be
label: BODY

text: incorporated into any contract for construc-
label: BODY

text: tion work or modification thereof, as defined
label: BODY

text: in the rules and regulations of the Secretary
label: BODY

text: of Labor relating to the land or housing in-
label: BODY

text: cluded in its request to the Department of
label: BODY

text: Veterans Affairs the following equal oppor-
label: BODY

text: tunity clause:
label: BODY

text: During the performance of this contract
label: BODY

text: the contractor agrees as follows:
label: BODY

text: (1) The contractor will not discriminate
label: BODY

text: against any employee or applicant for em-
label: BODY

text: ployment because of race, color, religion, sex
label: BODY

text: or national origin. The contractor will take
label: BODY

text: affirmative action to ensure that applicants
label: BODY

text: are employed, and that employees are treat-
label: BODY

text: ed during employment without regard to
label: BODY

text: their race, color, religion, sex or national or-
label: BODY

text: igin. Such action shall include, but not be
label: BODY

text: limited to the following: Employment, up-
label: BODY

text: grading, demotion or transfer; recruitment
label: BODY

text: or recruitment advertising; layoff or termi-
label: BODY

text: nation; rates of pay or other forms of com-
label: BODY

text: pensation; and selection for training, includ-
label: BODY

text: ing apprenticeship. The contractor agrees to
label: BODY

text: post in conspicuous places, available to em-
label: BODY

text: ployees and applicants for employment, no-
label: BODY

text: tices to be provided setting forth the provi-
label: BODY

text: sions of this nondiscrimination clause.
label: BODY

text: (2) The contractor will, in all solicitations
label: BODY

text: or advertisements for employees placed by or
label: BODY

text: on behalf of the contractor, state that all
label: BODY

text: qualified applicants will receive consider-
label: BODY

text: ation for employment without regard to
label: BODY

text: race, color, religion, sex or national origin.
label: BODY

text: (3) The contractor will send to each labor
label: BODY

text: union or representative of workers with
label: BODY

text: which he has a collective bargaining agree-
label: BODY

text: ment or other contract or understanding, a
label: BODY

text: notice to be provided advising the said labor
label: BODY

text: union or workers’ representative of the con-
label: BODY

text: tractor’s commitments under section 202 of
label: BODY

text: Executive Order 11246 of September 24, 1965,
label: BODY

text: and shall post copies of the notice in con-
label: BODY

text: spicuous places available to employees and
label: BODY

text: applicants for employment.
label: BODY

text: (4) The contractor will comply with all
label: BODY

text: provisions of Executive Order 11246 of Sep-
label: BODY

text: tember 24, 1965, and of the rules, regulations
label: BODY

text: and relevant orders of the Secretary of
label: BODY

text: Labor.
label: BODY

text: (5) The contractor will furnish all informa-
label: BODY

text: tion and reports required by Executive Order
label: BODY

text: 11246 of September 24, 1965, and by the rules,
label: BODY

text: regulations and orders of the Secretary of
label: BODY

text: Labor, or pursuant thereto, and will permit
label: BODY

text: access to his books, records and accounts by
label: BODY

text: the administering agency and the Secretary
label: BODY

text: of Labor for purposes of investigation to as-
label: BODY

text: certain compliance with such rules, regula-
label: BODY

text: tions and orders.
label: BODY

text: (6) In the event of the contractor’s non-
label: BODY

text: compliance
label: BODY

text: with
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: nondiscrimination
label: BODY

text: clauses of this contract or with any of the
label: BODY

text: said rules, regulations or orders, this con-
label: BODY

text: tract may be canceled, terminated or sus-
label: BODY

text: pended in whole or in part and the con-
label: BODY

text: tractor may be declared ineligible for further
label: BODY

text: Government contracts or federally assisted
label: BODY

text: construction contracts in accordance with
label: BODY

text: procedures authorized in Executive Order
label: BODY

text: 11246 of September 24, 1965, and such other
label: BODY

text: sanctions may be imposed and remedies in-
label: BODY

text: voked as provided in Executive Order 11246 of
label: BODY

text: September 24, 1965, or by rule, regulation or
label: BODY

text: order of the Secretary of Labor, or as other-
label: BODY

text: wise provided by law.
label: BODY

text: (7) The contractor will include the provi-
label: BODY

text: sions of paragraphs (1) through (7) in every
label: BODY

text: subcontract or purchase order unless ex-
label: BODY

text: empted by rules, regulations or orders of the
label: BODY

text: Secretary of Labor issued pursuant to sec-
label: BODY

text: tion 204 of Executive Order 11246 of Sep-
label: BODY

text: tember 24, 1965, so that such provisions will
label: BODY

text: be binding upon each subcontractor or ven-
label: BODY

text: dor. The contractor will take such action
label: BODY

text: with respect to any subcontract or purchase
label: BODY

text: order as the administering agency may di-
label: BODY

text: rect as a means of enforcing such provisions,
label: BODY

text: including sanctions for noncompliance: Pro-
label: BODY

text: vided, however, That in the event a con-
label: BODY

text: tractor becomes involved in, or is threatened
label: BODY

text: with, litigation with a subcontractor or ven-
label: BODY

text: dor as a result of such direction by the agen-
label: BODY

text: cy, the contractor may request the United
label: BODY

text: States to enter into such litigation to pro-
label: BODY

text: tect the interests of the United States.
label: BODY

text: Except in special cases and in subcontracts
label: BODY

text: for the performance of construction work at
label: BODY

text: the site of construction, the clause is not re-
label: BODY

text: quired to be inserted in subcontracts below
label: BODY

text: the second tier. Subcontracts may incor-
label: BODY

text: porate by reference the equal opportunity
label: BODY

text: clause.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Department of Veterans Affairs
label: BODY

text: The undersigned further agrees that it will
label: BODY

text: be bound by the above equal opportunity
label: BODY

text: clause in any federally assisted construction
label: BODY

text: work which it performs itself other than
label: BODY

text: through the permanent work force directly
label: BODY

text: employed by an agency of Government.
label: BODY

text: The undersigned agrees that it will cooper-
label: BODY

text: ate actively with the administering agency
label: BODY

text: and the Secretary of Labor in obtaining the
label: BODY

text: compliance of contractors and subcontrac-
label: BODY

text: tors with the equal opportunity clause and
label: BODY

text: the rules, regulations and relevant orders of
label: BODY

text: the Secretary of Labor, that it will furnish
label: BODY

text: the administering agency and the Secretary
label: BODY

text: of Labor such information as they may re-
label: BODY

text: quire for the supervision of such compliance,
label: BODY

text: and that it will otherwise assist the admin-
label: BODY

text: istering agency in the discharge of the agen-
label: BODY

text: cy’s primary responsibility for securing com-
label: BODY

text: pliance. The undersigned further agrees that
label: BODY

text: it will refrain from entering into any con-
label: BODY

text: tract or contract modification subject to Ex-
label: BODY

text: ecutive
label: BODY

text: Order
label: BODY

text: with
label: BODY

text: contractor
label: BODY

text: debarred from, or who has not demonstrated
label: BODY

text: eligibility for, Government contracts and
label: BODY

text: federally assisted construction contracts
label: BODY

text: pursuant to Part II, Subpart D of Executive
label: BODY

text: Order 11246 and will carry out such sanctions
label: BODY

text: and penalties for violation of the equal op-
label: BODY

text: portunity clause as may be imposed upon the
label: BODY

text: contractors and subcontractors by the ad-
label: BODY

text: ministering agency or the Secretary of
label: BODY

text: Labor pursuant to Part II, Subpart D of Ex-
label: BODY

text: ecutive Order 11246.
label: BODY

text: In addition, the undersigned agrees that if
label: BODY

text: it fails or refuses to comply with these un-
label: BODY

text: dertakings such failure or refusal shall be a
label: BODY

text: proper basis for cancellation by the Depart-
label: BODY

text: ment of Veterans Affairs of any outstanding
label: BODY

text: master certificates of reasonable value or in-
label: BODY

text: dividual certificates of reasonable value re-
label: BODY

text: lating to proposed construction, except in re-
label: BODY

text: spect to cases in which an eligible veteran
label: BODY

text: has contracted to purchase a property in-
label: BODY

text: cluded on such certificates, and for the rejec-
label: BODY

text: tion of future requests submitted by the un-
label: BODY

text: dersigned or on his or her behalf for site ap-
label: BODY

text: proval, appraisal services, and direct loan
label: BODY

text: fund reservation commitments until satis-
label: BODY

text: factory assurance of future compliance has
label: BODY

text: been received from the undersigned, and for
label: BODY

text: referral of the case to the Department of
label: BODY

text: Justice for appropriate legal proceedings.
label: BODY

text: [31 FR 8745, June 24, 1966, as amended at 40
label: BODY

text: Complaint and hearing pro-
label: BODY

text: cedure.
label: BODY

text: (a) Upon receipt of a written com-
label: BODY

text: plaint signed by the complainant to
label: BODY

text: the effect that any person, firm or enti-
label: BODY

text: ty has violated the undertakings re-
label: BODY

text: ferred to in § 36.4392, such person, firm
label: BODY

text: or other entity shall be invited to dis-
label: BODY

text: cuss the matter in an informal hearing
label: BODY

text: with the Director of the Department of
label: BODY

text: Veterans Affairs regional office or cen-
label: BODY

text: ter.
label: BODY

text: (b) If the existence of a violation is
label: BODY

text: denied by the person, firm or other en-
label: BODY

text: tity against which a complaint has
label: BODY

text: been made, the Director or designee
label: BODY

text: shall conduct such inquiries and hear-
label: BODY

text: ings as may be deemed appropriate for
label: BODY

text: the purpose of ascertaining the facts.
label: BODY

text: (c) If it is found that the person, firm
label: BODY

text: or other entity against which a com-
label: BODY

text: plaint has been made has not violated
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: undertakings
label: BODY

text: referred
label: BODY

text: § 36.4392, the parties shall be so noti-
label: BODY

text: fied.
label: BODY

text: (d) If it is found that there has been
label: BODY

text: a violation of the undertakings re-
label: BODY

text: ferred to in § 36.4392, the person, firm or
label: BODY

text: other entity in violation shall be re-
label: BODY

text: quested to attend a conference for the
label: BODY

text: purpose of discussing the matter. Fail-
label: BODY

text: ure or refusal to attend such a con-
label: BODY

text: ference shall be proper basis for the ap-
label: BODY

text: plication of sanctions.
label: BODY

text: (e) The conference arranged for dis-
label: BODY

text: cussing a violation shall be conducted
label: BODY

text: in an informal manner and shall have
label: BODY

text: as its primary objective the elimi-
label: BODY

text: nation of the violation. If the violation
label: BODY

text: is eliminated and satisfactory assur-
label: BODY

text: ances are received that the person,
label: BODY

text: firm or other entity in violation will
label: BODY

text: comply with the undertakings pursu-
label: BODY

text: ant to § 36.4392 in the future, the parties
label: BODY

text: concerned shall be so notified.
label: BODY

text: (f) Failure or refusal to comply and
label: BODY

text: give satisfactory assurances of future
label: BODY

text: compliance with the equal employment
label: BODY

text: opportunity
label: BODY

text: requirements
label: BODY

text: shall
label: BODY

text: proper basis for applying sanctions.
label: BODY

text: The sanctions shall be applied in ac-
label: BODY

text: cordance with the provisions of Execu-
label: BODY

text: tive Order 11246 as amended and the
label: BODY

text: regulations of the Secretary of Labor.
label: BODY

text: (g) Upon written application, a com-
label: BODY

text: plainant or a person, firm or other en-
label: BODY

text: tity against which a complaint has
label: BODY

text: been filed may apply to the Under Sec-
label: BODY

text: retary for Benefits for a review of the
label: BODY

text: action taken by a Director. Upon re-
label: BODY

text: ceiving such application, the Under
label: BODY

text: Secretary for Benefits may designate a
label: BODY

text: representative or representatives to
label: BODY

text: conduct an informal hearing and to
label: BODY

text: make a report of findings. The Under
label: BODY

text: Secretary for Benefits may, after a re-
label: BODY

text: view of such report, modify or reverse
label: BODY

text: an action taken by a Director.
label: BODY
